intro: Lintonia brizoides, commonly known as the slender meadow grass, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Lintonia brizoides typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
